reasoning: Ankylosing spondylitis shows global incidence ~7.3 per 100k with significant geographic variation (higher in northern European populations ~14 per 100k, lower in Asian populations ~2 per 100k). Prevalence approximately 45 per 100k based on HLA-B27 association and population studies.
source: de Vlam K et al. (2005). EULAR recommendations for screening, diagnosis and management of B27 positive patients with axial spondyloarthritis. Ann Rheum Dis. 66(10):1330-1333

reasoning: ARPKD (autosomal recessive form) is rarer than ADPKD, with estimated incidence ~0.8-1.0 per 100k births. This is specifically the autosomal recessive subtype, distinct from the more common autosomal dominant form.
source: Zerres K et al. (2003). Autosomal recessive polycystic kidney disease. J Am Soc Nephrol. 14(12):2935-2942

reasoning: Truncus arteriosus is a rare congenital heart defect accounting for ~0.4-1% of congenital heart disease. Global incidence estimated at 0.015-0.025 per 100k births. Using midpoint estimate of ~0.018 per 100k.
source: Jacobs JP et al. (2004). Nomenclature and definition of terms used in the Congenital Heart Surgery Database of The Society of Thoracic Surgeons. Ann Thorac Surg. 78(4):1457-1462

reasoning: Complex partial seizures (temporal lobe seizures) are the most common type of focal seizure. Global epilepsy incidence ~50 per 100k, with complex partial seizures comprising ~60-70% of focal epilepsy cases. Estimated incidence ~30-40 per 100k. Prevalence reflects all people with epilepsy experiencing this seizure type.
source: Hauser WA et al. (2005). Prevalence of epilepsy and undiagnosed seizures in the United States. Epilepsia. 46(8):1102-1109

reasoning: Schizoaffective disorder is less common than schizophrenia, with estimated incidence ~0.5-0.8 per 100k per year. Prevalence approximately 25 per 100k among those with mood/psychotic disorders combined. Lower confidence due to diagnostic variability and changing DSM criteria over time.
source: Narrow WE et al. (2002). Use of mental health services by persons with serious mental illness or substance use disorders. Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration
